name: xMatters
description: This app integrates with xMatters to retrieve information about events and users

client_id.description: Client ID. OAuth will be preferred if provided

actions.description: Run a quick query on the server to check the connection and credentials
Get information about a single event

example_value: Engage with this incident as a resolver

actions.description: Update the status of an event

identifier.description: Either the Target Name or ID of the user

embed_roles.description: Include a list of each user's role

example_value: Has all permissions and has access to the developer tab.

actions.verbose: See this link for more information on the parameters. The input expects the actual string literal representations of their respective fields. Lists need to be enclosed in square braces, objects in curly braces, etc.

properties.description: A JSON object of property names and values

callbacks.description: The list of Event Update Callback Objects

responses.description: The comma-separated list of response option UUIDs

actions.description: Get information about multiple users matching a property name/value

search.description: Search term. Will check first name, last name, web login, etc. Separate values with either space or a + sign

embed_roles.description: Include a list of each users' roles

offset.description: Number of items to skip before returning results

limit.description: The number of items to return

example_value: Has all permissions and has access to the developer tab.

actions.description: Query for specific events by providing a property name/value

offset.description: Number of items to skip before returning results

limit.description: The number of items to return

from.description: A date in UTC Format for the start of a time range to search

to.description: A date in UTC Format for the end of a time range to search

actions.description: Get information about multiple groups matching a property

search_group.description: Search term will check in name and description of groups. Separate multiple values with either space or a + sign

members.description: The targetName or id of users, dynamic teams or devices that are part of a group. Separate multiple values with commma

embed_observers.description: Includes a list of observers for a group

embed_supervisors.description: Includes a list of supervisors for a group

output.example_value: Users with the ability to add, edit, view, and remove any Scenario.

actions.description: Get information about who is on call over a given timeframe

groups.description: Name or id of a group. Separate multiple values with commma

members_per_shift.description: The number of shift members to include (max 100)

from.description: Date time value in UTC format (Eg. 2017-02-23T04:00:00Z)

to.description: Date time value in UTC format (Eg. 2017-02-26T04:00:00Z)

example_values: Successfully retrieved who is on call

output.example_value: Example group showing rotating daytime, evening and weekend shifts
